00070 template<class C, class A0, class R> class bound_mem_fun_t : public std::unary_function<A0, R> {
00071         public:         bound_mem_fun_t(R (C::*m)(A0), C* o) : m(m), o(o) { }
00072         public:         R operator()(A0 a) const { return (o->*m)(a); }
00073         protected:      R (C::*m)(A0);
00074         protected:      C* o;
00075 };
00076 
00088 template<class C, class A0, class R> inline bound_mem_fun_t<C, A0, R> bound_mem_fun(R (C::*m)(A0), C* o) {
00089         return bound_mem_fun_t<C, A0, R>(m, o);
00090 }

00103 template<class S> class Exception : public std::exception {
00104         public:         Exception(const S& error) : error(error) { }                                                                                                                    
00105         public:         virtual S getError() const throw() { return error; }                                                                                                    
00106         public:         virtual const char *what() const throw() { return (converted = toStdString(error)).c_str(); }                   
00107         public:         virtual ~Exception() throw() { }                                                                                                                                                // (GCC requires explicit destructor with one that has throw().)
00108         protected:      S error;                                                                                                                                                                                                
00109         protected:      mutable std::string converted;                                                                                                                                                  
00110 };

00160         public:         STLValue(uint i) : S(int2string<S, ulong>(i)) { }

00179         public:         bool operator>(const STLValue& r) const { return r < (*this); }

00202 enum Precedence {
00203         NO_TRACE = 0            
00204         , ERROR = 1                     
00205         , CALL = 2                      
00206         , STATEMENT = 3         
00207         , BODY = 4                      
00208         , ARGUMENT = 5          
00209         , BRACKETS = 6          
00210         , ASSIGN = 7            
00211         , LOGICAL_OR = 8        
00212         , LOGICAL_AND = 9       
00213         , BIT_OR = 10           
00214         , BIT_XOR = 11          
00215         , BIT_AND = 12          
00216         , EQUALITY = 13         
00217         , COMPARE = 14          
00218         , CONCAT = 15           
00219         , SHIFT = 16            
00220         , ADD_SUB = 17          
00221         , MUL_DIV = 18          
00222         , PREFIX = 19           
00223         , POSTFIX = 20          
00224         , DEFINITION = 21       
00225 };

00405         class STLVariables : public Variables {
00406                 public:         typedef std::map<const String, Value> VariableMap;
00407                 public:         typedef std::map<const String, Native* > NativeMap;
00408                 public:         virtual bool lookup(const String& symbol, Value& result);
00409                 public:         virtual bool assign(const String& symbol, const Value& value) { vars[symbol] = value; return true; }
00410                 public:         virtual void erase(const String& symbol) { vars.erase(symbol); }
00411                 public:         virtual void list(const String& key, VarList& list);
00412                 public:         virtual Native* lookupNative(const String& name);
00413                 public:         virtual bool assignNative(const String& name, Native* native);
00414                 public:         virtual ~STLVariables();
00415                 public:         VariableMap vars;
00416                 public:         NativeMap natives;
00417         };

00454         template<class F, class A0 = typename F::argument_type, class R = typename F::result_type> class UnaryFunctor
00455                         : public Native {
00456                 public:         UnaryFunctor(const F& functor) : func(functor) { }
00457                 protected:      template<class T> const Value arg(Frame& f, const T&) { return f.get(STR("$0")); }                                      
00458                 protected:      Frame& arg(Frame& f, const Dumb<Frame&>&) { return f; }                                                                                         
00459                 protected:      template<class A, class T> Value call(A& a, const Dumb<T>&) { return func(a); }                                         
00460                 protected:      template<class A> Value call(A& a, const Dumb<void>&) { func(a); return Value(); }                                      
00461                 public:         virtual Value pikaCall(Frame& f) { return call(arg(f, Dumb<A0>()), Dumb<R>()); }
00462                 protected:      F func;
00463         };
00464         
00468         template<class F, class A0 = typename F::first_argument_type, class A1 = typename F::second_argument_type
00469                         , class R = typename F::result_type> class BinaryFunctor : public Native {
00470                 public:         BinaryFunctor(const F& functor) : func(functor) { }
00471                 protected:      template<class T> Value call(const Value& a0, const Value& a1, const T&) { return func(a0, a1); }       
00472                 protected:      Value call(const Value& a0, const Value& a1, const Dumb<void>&) { func(a0, a1); return Value(); }       
00473                 public:         virtual Value pikaCall(Frame& f) { return call(f.get(STR("$0")), f.get(STR("$1")), Dumb<R>()); }
00474                 protected:      F func;
00475         };
00476         
00477         template<class F> static UnaryFunctor<F>* newUnaryFunctor(const F& f) { return new UnaryFunctor<F>(f); }                        
00478         template<class F> static BinaryFunctor<F>* newBinaryFunctor(const F& f) { return new BinaryFunctor<F>(f); }
